document.title: Health Education Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

A5C81A081EB5423E953A9A11782B3F6D.description: Share the importance of reusing items and materials with school and family.

4F94C43057164BE9A85AF55FA901E382.description:
Demonstrate acceptable behavior in classrooms and during play, including showing
respect for the personal space of others.

BBF0A995FF384879B844A5A06AD8B2F3.description:
Demonstrate how to tell someone they are entering one’s personal space and when to
ask an adult for help.

B8197F52E5574AF39DB967A689CDB005.description:
Demonstrate strategies for making friends and showing kindness, consideration, and
concern for others.

6131E130B24449989CC250E6EDE52C72.description: Demonstrate how to use words to express feelings.

3CDB7FC2D00245208180B758B6934EB3.description:
Recognize that some household products are harmful if touched, ingested, or inhaled
and the importance of asking adults before touching, ingesting, or inhaling white
powder or other unknown substances.

0EA68FB727874A7E80DCBF49D477AE40.description:
Describe why it is important to ask adults for help in an emergency, how to ask for
help, and how to call 911.

3FE6937C161344BEA71542EE4D873FD7.description: Describe common safety rules and practices at home, at school, and in communities.

B79D7CCB74884946A5839CE0B0E1B2E0.description: Identify adults to ask for help and assistance with harmful and unknown substances.

261BED4A13D94065B631F9DA5A42AE00.description:
Discuss why medicines should only be taken under the supervision of a
parent/guardian.

0408620DD12A4C9380B3D1F18C928DB3.description: Demonstrate how to brush and floss teeth correctly.

4F98D8791D734930A77824D2CBD6FB95.description: Describe ways to calm down before bed to prepare for sleeping.

84B07D398CD747EE88A3C261E10E4A7D.description:
Describe ways to participate regularly in physical activities inside and outside of
school.

8D72569A87524EE5B71F09734A05390B.description:
Describe how to help people with food allergies (e.g., being respectful of restrictions in
the classroom and cafeteria, not sharing food, getting help from an adult).

4FA57025A09747DC9CAD812BF92729A9.description: Create a shopping list that includes foods from each MyPlate food group.

D2B4911BF72C45859158B8CA298B9230.description: Describe ways to protect the five senses.

033DE60E2933448B9AAF2133FA3B0F82.description:
Describe the different body parts involved in one movement (e.g., jumping, walking,
biking).

7ACFED9BA70D4959A9D268753121E047.description:
The student will describe and demonstrate behaviors that promote health and prevent injury
and disease.

6A247FE0996F4F15AB3782E1E6253BFF.description: Describe ways to reuse items and materials in the classroom.

569E66AE49D7436EA8E26CCE80F7E8F4.description: Explain how classmates can support one another at school.

E0FBECDB08E447ED9DA781B1CD1FAFA4.description: Identify ways to tell someone they are entering one’s personal space.

3DE910C1D92F47119210C4B25A471F64.description:
Identify strategies for making friends and how to show kindness, consideration, and
concern for others, including how to cooperate and share with others.

A540A40C775440F58E481511674D91E7.description: Describe how feelings can influence actions.

02A0B1D7753243CE9B9EC72923293183.description: Recognize that not all products advertised or sold are healthy or safe.

BCDC5ED9074F42788151584389538C7E.description: Identify people who can help in an emergency and in non-emergency situations.

CC5634EE297C4821AD658C7F6180F218.description:
Describe how safety choices can prevent injuries (e.g., wearing a helmet, tying
shoelaces, using seat belts and safety seats, sitting in the back seat of vehicles with
airbags).

CF6B3DB2FE064CF8B857B498751E29F4.description:
Identify the meaning of safety signs, symbols, and warning labels and understand the
dangers of white powder and other unknown substances.

D9526D780E4E486093C9DE98CA3F4C35.description: Describe consequences of taking medications unsupervised.

A0DD5B5B7D774058A6E1AFBCE6046F94.description:
Discuss the benefits of personal hygiene practices (e.g., tooth brushing, flossing, hand
washing, grooming).

3B9713226F764C829737589FA6EA5297.description:
Explain how hand washing helps remove bacteria and viruses that can make people
sick, and describe situations where it is important to wash hands.

446F02D714604E2E97EEADCA756C94F9.description:
Identify positive physical activity options and the benefits of being physically active
every day.

90F93164A1A842528EE2FD9CA8D45F5D.description: Identify foods that most often cause allergies.

A1A073A1C9244342BA0C3AF1B046DB9A.description:
Describe healthy meal, snack, and beverage options that include food from the MyPlate
food groups (i.e., dairy, proteins, vegetables, fruits, grains).

0BF25F34EF694FC19EF65F40A840FB50.description: Identify situations that require the use of each of the five senses.

7FC507DE0C144EEB91AD647E690B5B85.description: Recognize how the major body parts work together to move.

C8E3110C821D4920AB81FF0785E49B47.description: The student will identify healthy decisions.

8AD7DDA35F814C80B078BAB8F688BF19.description:
Identify items and materials that can be reused (e.g., grocery bags, paper, water bottles,
other containers).

9AF151F98BDB43B59171B34B3CD21544.description:
Recognize that classroom rules are important for school (e.g., sharing, respecting
others).

C601E61479B74553B6DCEA7DF270D6C1.description:
Describe what it means to be a friend and how to show kindness, consideration, and
concern for others (i.e., self-awareness, social awareness, and relationship skills).

27F4A72B732E4CFF8E261907D76B6921.description:
Identify a variety of feelings (e.g., happiness, sadness, anger, fear, frustration,
calmness).

71529BB329E64DAC93078DB192FB93B8.description: Identify household products that are harmful or poisonous.

0441E9457898420FA2C323931E494EBD.description: Describe pedestrian, bike, bus, and playground safety practices.

5FB7E5D370EB43CEA65F2F0675D71167.description:
Describe how medicine and other substances can be helpful or harmful, and recognize
poison warning labels.

DAA1E334742E45F0BF3FF6E127595E84.description:
Identify medicine as a pill or liquid that can be taken to feel better when sick but can
cause harm if misused.

72224FA2311B4177B2FABBC05777BAC9.description:
Describe the function of the teeth, how to take care of them, and the health
professionals that help care for teeth (e.g., dentist, hygienist).

EC23DBA202A942F5A320CBDE86A4401F.description:
Define germs and describe how germs (e.g., bacteria, viruses) may cause common
diseases (e.g., cold, flu).

4F1D3DD80B8545C192AD52F05E5A9F49.description: Recognize the importance of a regular bedtime routine and enough sleep.

8FCD1F7DCA9D44EFAD11B4691A8F065D.description:
Describe different types of physical activity and recognize the need for regular physical
activity.

3E37BE814B95432A99465D3372486D4A.description: Explain what it means to have a food allergy.

0BF30F1B1B2B431DAC877F6BE861643D.description:
Identify the MyPlate food groups (i.e., dairy, proteins, vegetables, fruits, grains) and a variety
of foods and beverages from each group.

D6A409EE33E641F5AA5AB6B8B9C4281C.description: Describe the five senses (i.e., sight, hearing, smell, taste, touch).

3BF50387D54040949135374BF7EE5201.description: Identify major body parts (e.g., head, torso, arms, legs, hands, feet, muscles, bones).

3685E2E23565408C843E2DCB69FEF435.description: The student will identify and describe key health and safety concepts.
